html: The House overwhelmingly passed my bill, the #NATOSupportAct, on a bipartisan 357 – 22 vote. Congress must ensure that America will continue to hold a strategic advantage over our adversaries both now and into the future. To do so, we must enshrine our commitment to #NATO in law
text: The House overwhelmingly passed my bill, the #NATOSupportAct, on a bipartisan 357 – 22 vote. Congress must ensure that America will continue to hold a strategic advantage over our adversaries both now and into the future. To do so, we must enshrine our commitment to #NATO in law

html: However, what must be made clear is that membership in NATO is not membership in a country club. It is a solemn commitment to the defense of the world order. For it to succeed for another 70 years, the United States must continue to invest in the alliance.
text: However, what must be made clear is that membership in NATO is not membership in a country club. It is a solemn commitment to the defense of the world order.  For it to succeed for another 70 years, the United States must continue to invest in the alliance.

html: #NATOSupportAct affirms that our NATO partners must pay at least 2 percent of their GDP on defense and promotes robust funding for the European Deterrence Initiative to counter Russian aggression.
text: #NATOSupportAct affirms that our NATO partners must pay at least 2 percent of their GDP on defense and promotes robust funding for the European Deterrence Initiative to counter Russian aggression.

html: NATO secretary general, in speech to Congress, says "America has been the backbone of our alliance" and stresses "we would not have the peaceful and prosperous Europe we see today without the sacrifice and commitment of the United States."
text: NATO secretary general, in speech to Congress, says "America has been the backbone of our alliance" and stresses "we would not have the peaceful and prosperous Europe we see today without the sacrifice and commitment of the United States."

html: Today, in the face of Russian threats and attacks on American and allied interests, the U.S. must take a stand and solidify our commitment to our allies. We must live up to the #NATO pledge that an attack on one of us is an attack on all of us. #NATOSupportAct
text: Today, in the face of Russian threats and attacks on American and allied interests, the U.S. must take a stand and solidify our commitment to our allies. We must live up to the #NATO pledge that an attack on one of us is an attack on all of us. #NATOSupportAct

html: I left that country in 2008, but after 17 years of our engagement there, NATO troops are still serving alongside our men and women in uniform.
text: I left that country in 2008, but after 17 years of our engagement there, NATO troops are still serving alongside our men and women in uniform.

html: We continue to see #NATO’s value in our enduring fight against terrorism. In the hours after the 9/11 attacks on our soil, our NATO partners volunteered to invoke Article 5. I served alongside many troops from many NATO countries during my service in Afghanistan.
text: We continue to see #NATO’s value in our enduring fight against terrorism. In the hours after the 9/11 attacks on our soil, our NATO partners volunteered to invoke Article 5. I served alongside many troops from many NATO countries during my service in Afghanistan.

html: Established in an effort to contain Soviet expansionism after World War II, #NATO has preserved peace, fostered economic prosperity, and promoted democratic governance. The mutual defense pledge is why NATO has been the most successful alliance in history.
text:
Established in an effort to contain Soviet expansionism after World War II, #NATO has preserved peace, fostered economic prosperity, and promoted democratic governance.
The mutual defense pledge is why NATO has been the most successful alliance in history.

html: Today is a good day for our four-legged friends across America! After recent action from our bipartisan #KITTENAct coalition, the @USDA announced today they are ending their experiments that kill kittens. Thank you to everyone who urged the USDA to end this horrific practice.pic.twitter.com/4P82d6qAzE
text: Today is a good day for our four-legged friends across America! After recent action from our bipartisan #KITTENAct coalition, the @USDA announced today they are ending their experiments that kill kittens. Thank you to everyone who urged the USDA to end this horrific practice.pic.twitter.com/4P82d6qAzE

html: The House just passed HR 1112, closing the Charleston Loophole. It is humbling to be a part of a Congress that, after over two decades, finally passed two major pieces of legislation (#HR8, #HR1112) to strengthen background checks that can lead to the reduction of gun violence.
text: The House just passed HR 1112, closing the Charleston Loophole. It is humbling to be a part of a Congress that, after over two decades, finally passed two major pieces of legislation (#HR8, #HR1112) to strengthen background checks that can lead to the reduction of gun violence.

html: Today, I will vote for #HR1112 to close the Charleston loophole. This bill will allow the FBI more time to run background checks so we can stop prohibited gun owners from slipping through the cracks.
text: Today, I will vote for #HR1112 to close the Charleston loophole. This bill will allow the FBI more time to run background checks so we can stop prohibited gun owners from slipping through the cracks.

html: Today, I will vote for #HR8 the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. The purpose of the bill is straightforward - to ensure that individuals already prohibited from gun possession under federal law are not able to obtain firearms. It closes the background check loophole.
text: Today, I will vote for #HR8 the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. The purpose of the bill is straightforward - to ensure that individuals already prohibited from gun possession under federal law are not able to obtain firearms.  It closes the background check loophole.

text:
1 year ago on 2/14/18, 17 were killed in a senseless act of gun violence at Stoneman Douglas HS in Parkland.

html: Today @HouseJudiciary held the first hearing on gun violence in nearly a decade. I shared the story of my son, Jordan, a victim of gun violence. Our stories are vitally important as we work to pass common-sense legislation to #EndGunViolence. Congress finally is #TakingAction.pic.twitter.com/tz6SdGQiid
text:
Today @HouseJudiciary held the first hearing on gun violence in nearly a decade.

I shared the story of my son, Jordan, a victim of gun violence.

Our stories are vitally important as we work to pass common-sense legislation to #EndGunViolence.

Congress finally is #TakingAction.pic.twitter.com/tz6SdGQiid

html: This shutdown had a negative impact on federal workers&their families &on our economic &national security. To ensure this never happens again our leadership must put politics&emotion aside and focus on the policy&evidence of reasonable border security&necessary immigration reform

html: I am pleased that the President finally took the necessary step to reopen our government so that federal employees can return to work and get paid. This could have been avoided in December, but this administration used the shutdown as a tool for a political agenda.
text: I am pleased that the President finally took the necessary step to reopen our government so that federal employees can return to work and get paid.  This could have been avoided in December, but this administration used the shutdown as a tool for a political agenda.

html: The House has voted on 11 bills to reopen the government. It's time for the Senate to get serious about ending the shutdown. That must be the number one priority.
text: The House has voted on 11 bills to reopen the government. It's time for the Senate to get serious about ending the shutdown. That must be the number one priority.

html: The House has passed bipartisan legislation expressing congressional support for NATO. The bill, which passed in a 357-22 vote, includes a provision rejecting any efforts from Trump to potentially withdraw from NATO. All "no" votes were from Republicans.https://thehill.com/homenews/house/426488-house-passes-bill-expressing-support-for-nato …
text:
The House has passed bipartisan legislation expressing congressional support for NATO.

The bill, which passed in a 357-22 vote, includes a provision rejecting any efforts from Trump to potentially withdraw from NATO. All "no" votes were from Republicans.https://thehill.com/homenews/house/426488-house-passes-bill-expressing-support-for-nato …

html: I am proud to announce that today, the House of Representatives passed my bipartisan legislation, H.R. 676, the #NATOSupportAct, which rejects any efforts by the President to withdraw from the #NATO alliance and prohibits the use of funds to take any such action.pic.twitter.com/fFLqTJbcyv
text: I am proud to announce that today, the House of Representatives passed my bipartisan legislation, H.R. 676, the #NATOSupportAct, which rejects any efforts by the President to withdraw from the #NATO alliance and prohibits the use of funds to take any such action.pic.twitter.com/fFLqTJbcyv

html: The #NATOSupportAct rejects any efforts by the President to withdraw from the alliance. Moreover, the measure supports NATO member efforts to spend at least 2% of their GDP on defense and promotes robust funding for the European Deterrence Initiative to counter Russian aggression
text: The #NATOSupportAct rejects any efforts by the President to withdraw from the alliance. Moreover, the measure supports NATO member efforts to spend at least 2% of their GDP on defense and promotes robust funding for the European Deterrence Initiative to counter Russian aggression

html: Today, I introduced the bipartisan #NATOSupportAct. The legislation reiterates strong Congressional support for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (#NATO), the longest-standing and most successful military alliance in the world.

html: Last week, Congress passed two bills to reopen government services, ensure workers get the paychecks they have earned, and restore certainty to the lives of the American people. The bills also included provisions to provide back pay to federal employees.
text: Last week, Congress passed two bills to reopen government services, ensure workers get the paychecks they have earned, and restore certainty to the lives of the American people.  The bills also included provisions to provide back pay to federal employees.

html: Despite the President proudly prolonging the partial government shut down, the House of Representatives has passed legislation to reopen our government.
text: Despite the President proudly prolonging the partial government shut down, the House of Representatives has passed legislation to reopen our government.

html: The ripple effect from this shut down will be felt far and beyond the people who rely on the federal government for employment and benefits, but also will be felt by every day Americans as some basic government services are stopped.

html: Today, the House will pass legislation to end the partial government shutdown. I hope that we can come together to fully open the government and support the dedicated individuals who provide our nation with critical safety, security, and emergency management services.

html: Despite the President's rejection of those proposals and his call for this shutdown, Democrats will continue to work with Republicans to come to an agreement to reopen our government.

html: Decisively, Congressional Democrats offered multiple proposals to keep the government open, including one that passed the Senate unanimously, and all of which included funding for strong, sensible, and effective border security, not an ineffective and expensive wall.

html: I join our country in mourning the passing of President George H.W. Bush. He was a true public servant who dedicated his life to make ours a ‘kinder, gentler nation.’ He was led by his moral character, integrity, and common sense. I offer my deepest sympathies to family.
text: I join our country in mourning the passing of President George H.W. Bush.  He was a true public servant who dedicated his life to make ours a ‘kinder, gentler nation.’ He was led by his moral character, integrity, and common sense.  I offer my deepest sympathies to family.

html: The US & our NATO allies ensure enduring peace, stability, and security around the world. Naming the headquarters after Senator McCain is a tribute to his support for the alliance,& signals Congress’s commitment to the institutions & individuals that enhance our national security
text: The US & our NATO allies ensure enduring peace, stability, and security around the world. Naming the headquarters after Senator McCain is a tribute to his support for the alliance,& signals Congress’s commitment to the institutions & individuals that enhance our national security

html: I joined @RepGallagher in introducing a bipartisan House resolution to support renaming @NATO's headquarters after the late Senator John McCain. Senator John McCain understood the importance of NATO & America’s steadfast role in the alliance.

html: My constituents continue to express their frustration with the gridlock that they see in Washington. The current House rules make it too easy for regular order to break down, which rewards partisanship & causes important bills to fail before they have a chance to be considered.
